results.title: River of my Life
results.creator_credit: Amira Sabanovic and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Amira describes the course her life has taken - from the ravages of War in her homeland through to the hardships of a refugee’s life in both Europe and Australia before finding acceptance and fulfillment through a supportive workplace.

results.title: Lore of the land
results.brief_description: This CD-ROM was created with assistance from the Cinemedia Mutlimedia 21 Fund by Fraynework Multimedia, a not-for-profit website, video and multimedia production house established by the Sisters of Mercy, Melbourne Congregation. The work is a documentary and interactive exploration of issues of identity, belonging and reconciliation in Australia. It names the land as that which settlers and indigenous peoples share in common, both as a physical resource and as a symbolic mediator of the spiritual. The user is taken on an interactive journey of discovery structured around five areas: Experience, Indigienous Culture, Land Issues, Understanding and Discovery. Content includes a detailed timeline dating back 60,000 years, summary and analysis of legal judgments, interviews, songs and paintings. The Discovery ‘pathway’ is a game where participants travel through the landscape collecting icons and artefacts. The CD-ROM has a linked website and encourages users to keep a journal of their thoughts but can be run without these components.

results.title: Ablutions
results.brief_description: Ablutions is an interactive journey where the user controls the fate of a character in a world that consumes technology. Through exploring the narrative the user partakes in the experience of cleansing the self from everyday technology and its commodities; questioning the nature of our identity. By doing this, freedom is redefined. Once cleansed, the character recovers the lost items, discovering their meaning and importance.

results.title: My new home
results.creator_credit: Jaya Sharma and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A story of a young woman’s life journey - from a young bride in India to become the head of Hindi radio at SBS in Melbourne. Created in the ACMI ‘Diversity@Work’ Digital Storytelling program in association with Diversity @ Work, AMES, Australia POst and SBS.

results.title: Testimony: a story machine
results.brief_description:
“Testimony: A Story Machine” is an interactive comic strip. It is a story to be played with. The user may click where s/he pleases, causing images to be replaced, or characters to animate and change position. By changing one image in a sequence of (say) four frames, the story implied by the sequence of four is altered, even when the other three frames remain static. The ideas for the project came from my previous experiments with cut-up collages of text and cut-up collages of comics, and also my interest in film and shot sequence and comics and frame sequence.
While the user plays with the interactive, sometimes the story will change, sometimes it will advance to a new setting. The library of images, animation, text and sound is composed of broadly similar narrative themes, but it is the sequence which determines the story. There is no end. There are no rules for interpreting the story. The user cannot do anything wrong and how the user interprets what they find is up to them. It is a work of non-linear fiction. As author, I provide the ingredients, the computer provides the sequencing and the reader provides the meaning or interpretation.
